_comment: Created by ianb on 14/10/2013 11:46:14 using v0.9
title: How have NHS staff numbers changed by staff type?
analysis_commentary: The numbers of all staff has been increasing since 2002. However, this seems to have levelled since 2009 and the percentage increase has been around 21% from 2009 onwards. There are also stark differences in the different staff groups. We can see that the number of qualified nursing staff increased less than the other staff groups and seems to have stabilised since 2009. In contrast to this, the number of doctors has been steadily increasing every year and has increased by over 40% since 2002; compared to a 14% increase in nursing staff.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, NHS Hospital & Community Health Service Workforce Statistics
